oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery Interviews Chet Atkins - Parts 4 and 5
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Chet Atkins (performer) for the Ralph Emery Show. Tape labeled parts 4 and 5. Recording is from November 21, 1983.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Wings of an Eagle [excerpt] (Bobby Goldsboro) [Featuring Ralph Emery and Chet Atkins introduction voiceover] -- (00:25) Ralph Emery praises Chet Atkins' awards and Atkins recalls what he did to one of Jerry Reed's awards -- (02:39) Atkins and Emery reflect on the ability to harmonize with co workers, and Emery invites Atkins to discuss "Mrs. Robinson" -- (03:52) Emery invites Atkins to discuss the decisions made for choosing a guitar -- (05:40) Atkins introduces Sylvia and both discuss her growing success -- (06:09) Emery introduces "Windy and Warm," and Atkins recalls working with the Boston Pops Orchestra -- (08:03) Emery invites Atkins to reflect on Alabama -- (08:49) Emery calls "Where the Guitar is the Star" a cute song, and Atkins reveals the inspiration to the song -- (10:04) Emery invites Atkins to reflect on his recent show in San Jose -- (11:08) Atkins and Emery discuss how Atkins enjoys putting comedy in his shows -- (12:20) Emery and Atkins introduce the Texas Vocal Company and "Two Hearts" -- (12:42) Emery inquires whether or not Atkins would produce an album similar to 'Chet Atkins and Friends' -- (14:37) Wings of an Eagle [excerpt] (Bobby Goldsboro) [Featuring Emery and Atkins outro voiceover] -- (15:53) Wings of an Eagle [excerpt] (Bobby Goldsboro) [Featuring Emery and Atkins introduction voiceover] -- (16:17) Emery and Atkins praise Louise Mandrell while introducing "Save Me" -- (16:38) Atkins reveals "Chet's Tune" was a dedication to Atkins' twenty years at RCA -- (18:48) Emery and Atkins discuss the humor associated to "Aint'cha Tired of Making Me Blue" and Atkins' displeasure -- (22:04) Atkins and Emery discuss Atkins' fiddle skills -- (22:50) Atkins reveals a majority of his shows are small, and Emery inquires about the Magic Three -- (24:07) Emery invites Atkins to introduce Jerry Reed, and discuss his singing styles -- (25:08) Emery shifts the attention to Atkins' experience when recording with Merle Travis -- (26:44) Emery expresses how much Steve Wariner praises Atkins, and Atkins reveals how Wariner received his name -- (27:56) Atkins reflect on how much responsibility he had as a producer -- (28:56) Emery invites Atkins to promote his guitar; additionally, Emery inquires on why Atkins believes artists are popular -- (31:17) Emery introduces Gone With the Wind's theme "Tara's Theme" -- (32:02) Wings of an Eagle [excerpt] (Bobby Goldsboro) [Featuring Ralph Emery and Chet Atkins outro voiceover]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Atkins, Chet;
